item.title: Baseball's Unseen Bias: How wOBA Overlooks the True Value of Specific Outcomes
item.description: In my last post, I discussed the drawbacks of weighted on-base average (wOBA) and how its biases seep into other popular metrics like xwOBA, xERA, wRC+, and even some stuff quality models.

item.title: Rethinking wOBA, xwOBA, xERA, and Stuff+
item.description: I’ve been working on sxwOBA, a baseball statistic that aims to model expected hitting outcomes based on the exit velocity, launch angle, spray direction, and batter sprint speed of a given batted-ball event.
